Unemployment in Insured Industries.The latest date for which unemployment figures by industries are available is the 21st January, 1929, at which date the percentage unemployed in Great Britain and Northern Ireland was 12'3, as compared with 11'2 at the 17th December, 1928, with 10-7 at the 23rd January, 1928, and with 121 at the 24th January, 1927. Latest Figures.The latest figure of unemployment available is that for the 18th February, 1929, giving a total number on the registers for Great Britain of 1,458,000. This is an increase, part of which is due to temporary stoppages as a result of the frost, over the position on the 28th January, 1929, amounting to 63,922, and an increase over a year ago of 321,313.ARTHUR STBEL-MAITLAND.Ministry of Labour,March 4, 1929.
